item.title: 国债波动引发全球债券余震
item.description: 在美国国债市场混乱的一天之后，从澳大利亚到日本的债券都出现了波动，迫使交易员们正视这样一种可能性，即贸易战引发的动荡才刚刚开始。【原文：Bonds from Australia to Japan swung in the wake of a chaotic day in the US Treasuries market, forcing traders to confront the possibility that volatility from trade war jitters is only just beginning.】

item.title: 中美贸易战深化，人民币跌至 2007 年以来最弱水平
item.description: 中国在岸人民币跌至近二十年来的最弱水平，世界两大经济体之间的贸易紧张局势没有任何缓和的迹象。【原文：China’s onshore yuan dropped to the weakest level in nearly two decades with no signs of a let-up in trade tensions between the world’s two biggest economies.】

item.title: 中国股市连续第三天上涨，投资者押注经济刺激政策
item.description: 中国股市连续第三天上涨，反映了投资者对中国政府采取更多刺激措施的持续预期，以及对可能与美国达成贸易协议的希望。【原文：Chinese stocks rose for a third day, reflecting continued investor expectations of more stimulus support from Beijing as well as hopes for a possible trade deal with the US.】

item.title: 中国消费通缩持续，贸易战带来新风险
item.description: 由于与美国的贸易战不断升级，有可能给物价带来更大的下行压力，中国的消费通缩在 3 月份延续了第二个月。【原文：China’s consumer deflation extended for a second month in March, as an escalating trade war with the US threatens to put more downward pressure on prices.】

item.title: 美国关税缓和后台湾股价创纪录大涨
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普宣布暂停提高关税后，全球股市反弹，台湾股市周四创下历史新高。【原文：Taiwan stocks surged by a record on Thursday, tracking a global rebound after President Donald Trump announced a pause on higher tariffs.】

item.title: 东盟各国部长将于周四讨论应对特朗普关税的措施
item.description: 据官员称，东南亚国家联盟将于周四讨论他们作为一个集团可以采取哪些措施来应对唐纳德-特朗普总统的关税。【原文：The Association of Southeast Asian Nations will discuss on Thursday what they can do as a group to respond to President Donald Trump’s tariffs, according to officials.】

item.title: 沃尔玛缺失的价格显示消费者即将面临贸易混乱
item.description: 对于美国消费者来说，今年的圣诞节和其他很多节日都将更加昂贵。【原文：Christmas, and a lot else, will be more expensive this year for American consumers.】

item.title: 特朗普公布关税缓和措施后欧洲股市期货大涨
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普暂停对数十个贸易伙伴实施更高互惠关税的计划，缓解了人们对贸易战扩大的担忧之后，欧洲股票期货反弹。【原文：European stock futures rallied after US President Donald Trump paused plans to implement higher reciprocal tariffs on dozens of trade partners, easing concerns about a widening trade war.】

item.title: 越南与美国同意启动贸易协定谈判
item.description: 越南政府网站发布消息称，越南副总理胡德福（Ho Duc Phoc）在华盛顿会见了美国贸易代表杰米森-格里尔（Jamieson Greer），双方同意就 "互惠 "贸易协定展开谈判。【原文：Vietnam Deputy Prime Minister Ho Duc Phoc met with US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer in Washington and agreed to start negotiations on a “reciprocal” trade agreement, according to a post on the government website.】

item.title: 日本将在 90 天暂停期间继续要求关税减免
item.description: 日本最高贸易代表赤泽亮世表示，日本将继续敦促美国总统唐纳德-特朗普重新审视其关税措施，希望在美国总统突然决定暂缓征收部分对等关税后赢得缓和。【原文：Japan will continue to urge US President Donald Trump to review his tariff measures in hopes of winning a reprieve following the president’s abrupt decision to put a hold on some of the reciprocal tariffs, according to Ryosei Akazawa, the nation’s top trade representative.】

item.title: Seven & i 因回购计划和更广泛的购买而创下本月最大涨幅
item.description: Seven & i Holdings Co. 公司宣布计划在未来一年内回购价值 6000 亿日元（40 亿美元）的股票，帮助缓解了投资者对盈利前景疲软的担忧。【原文：Seven & i Holdings Co. jumped the most in a month after announcing a plan to buy back ¥600 billion ($4 billion) worth of shares over the next year, helping to ease investor concerns over a weaker earnings outlook.】

item.title: 征税混乱引发 18 个月最大涨幅后黄金微幅上扬
item.description: 由于对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普关税议程的困惑促使投资者买入贵金属作为避风港，黄金在创下18个月来最大单日涨幅后走高。【原文：Gold edged higher after posting its biggest one-day gain in 18 months, as confusion over US President Donald Trump’s tariff agenda drove investors to buy the precious metal as a haven.】

item.title: 投资者加大对弱势亚洲货币的期权押注
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统的美国关税政策和人民币的走势可能会使亚洲货币继续波动。【原文：President Donald Trump’s US tariff whiplash and the Chinese yuan’s trajectory will likely keep Asian currency volatility elevated.】

item.title: 新西兰提议建立基于规则的贸易集团以对抗关税
item.description: 新西兰总理克里斯托弗-卢克松提议成立一个以规则为基础的贸易集团，以应对美国可能损害依赖全球贸易的经济体的全面关税。【原文：New Zealand Prime Minister Christopher Luxon is proposing the formation of a rules-based trading bloc in response to sweeping US tariffs that threaten to hurt economies reliant on global trade.】

item.title: 特朗普暂停加征关税后日韩股市大涨
item.description: 4 月 9 日，纽约新闻集团大楼上的新闻播报器显示关税和股市新闻。摄影师：迈克尔-纳格尔/布鲁姆伯格【原文：A news ticker displays tariff and stock market news on the News Corp. building in New York on April 9. Photographer: Michael Nagle/Bloomberg】

item.title: OpenAI 称马斯克必须停止 "无情 "的伤害行动
item.description: OpenAI 指责埃隆-马斯克在一年多的时间里 "无情地 "破坏这家初创公司，并敦促法院命令他停止这样做。【原文：OpenAI accused Elon Musk of waging a “relentless” campaign for more than a year to damage the startup and urged a court to order him to stop.】

item.title: 绿色和平组织称，2024 年人工智能芯片制造排放将增加四倍
item.description: 根据绿色和平组织对公司和公开数据的分析，作为人工智能服务基础的半导体生产所产生的排放量在 2024 年增长了四倍多。【原文：Emissions generated from the production of semiconductors that underpin AI services grew more than fourfold in 2024, according to a Greenpeace analysis of company and publicly available data.】

item.title: 华尔街顾问保罗-阿特金斯被任命为美国证券交易委员会主席
item.description: 美国参议院确认保罗-阿特金斯为美国证券交易委员会主席，在唐纳德-特朗普总统全面征收关税引发市场动荡仅一周后，他就迎来了这一职位。【原文：The US Senate confirmed Paul Atkins as chair of the US Securities and Exchange Commission, ushering him into the role only a week after President Donald Trump’s sweeping tariffs unleashed market turmoil.】

item.title: 美联储倾向于抑制通胀，避免先发制人的降息行动
item.description: 即使劳动力市场进一步疲软，美联储官员也准备保持政策利率稳定，以尽量降低唐纳德-特朗普总统的关税引发通胀持续上升的风险。【原文：Federal Reserve officials are prepared to hold their policy rate steady to minimize the risk that President Donald Trump’s tariffs trigger a persistent rise in inflation, even if the labor market softens further.】

item.title: 特朗普改变立场后，石油从四年低点延续反弹势头
item.description: 由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）对关税计划做出部分缓和，点燃了全球纾困反弹，石油从四年低点延续反弹。【原文：Oil extended a rebound from a four-year low as a partial reprieve by President Donald Trump on tariff plans ignited a global relief rally.】

item.title: 美国通胀在关税影响前将有所缓解
item.description: 美国 3 月份的通胀率可能有所下降，部分原因是能源成本下降，在关税渗透经济之前为消费者提供了一些宽慰。【原文：US inflation likely stepped down in March, thanks in part to a drop in energy costs, offering some relief to consumers before tariffs filter through the economy.】

item.title: 关税缓和后，股市飙升，债券震荡：市场综述
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普暂停征收部分对等关税，此举震动了债券市场，并提振了亚洲股票期货，此后美国股市创下金融危机以来的最佳表现。【原文：US stocks posted the best day since the financial crisis after President Donald Trump paused some reciprocal tariffs in a move that jolted the bond market and lifted Asian equity futures.】

item.title: 刚刚发生了什么？解读特朗普的关税暂停政策
item.description: 几周来，唐纳德-特朗普总统一直在推进对进口商品征收新的高额关税的计划，尽管有人警告说这一政策可能会引发经济混乱。4 月 9 日，在全球股市连续多日暴跌之后，他改变了方向。【原文：For weeks, President Donald Trump has plowed ahead with plans to impose steep new tariffs on imports despite warnings that the policy could trigger economic chaos. On April 9, after a multiday plunge in global stock markets, he changed course.】

item.title: 特朗普暂缓提高关税后日本股市将跳涨
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普宣布暂停对大多数国家征收更高的关税 90 天后，日本股市将大涨，推动美国股市反弹，并使日元走低。【原文：Japanese stocks are set to surge after US President Donald Trump announced a 90-day pause on higher tariffs on most nations, driving a rally in US equities and sending the yen lower.】

item.title: 关税冲击业务，戴尔减少电脑折扣
item.description: 戴尔科技公司（Dell Technologies Inc. ）取消或缩小了其许多电脑在美国的折扣，这是消费者在关税计划摇摆不定的情况下可能不得不支付更多费用的最新迹象。【原文：Dell Technologies Inc. has eliminated or narrowed the US discounts on many of its computers, the latest sign that consumers may have to pay more in the face of vacillating tariff plans.】

item.title: 美联储哈马克称市场紧张但仍在运行
item.description: 克利夫兰联邦储备银行行长贝丝-哈马克（Beth Hammack）表示，尽管美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的贸易政策引发了近期的国债波动，但美国金融市场运行良好。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Cleveland President Beth Hammack said US financial markets are functioning well despite a recent bout of volatility in Treasuries sparked by President Donald Trump’s trade policies.】

item.title: 特朗普在关税问题上倒退，市场从恐惧转为欣喜
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）发动的 "美国对世界 "贸易战使全球股市和债券市场陷入混乱，令人痛心疾首的五天后，他做出了让步，并在这一过程中将金融体系从边缘拉了回来。【原文：Five gut-wrenching days after Donald Trump’s America-versus-the-world trade war threw stock and bond markets around the world into disarray, he backpedaled and, in the process, pulled the financial system back from the brink.】

item.title: 特朗普表示暂停关税后股市大涨
item.description:
美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）表示将在 90 天内暂停对数十个国家征收关税，周三收盘时股市创下 2020 年以来最大涨幅

。【原文：

US trading ended Wednesday with the biggest surge in stocks since 2020 after President Donald Trump said he’d pause tariffs on dozens of countries for 90 days

】

item.title: 特朗普签署命令重振美国造船业，DOGE 对海军进行审查
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周三签署了一项行政命令，旨在重振美国造船业，并将派遣埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的效率小分队调查美国海军在建造舰艇方面为何落后如此之多。【原文：President Donald Trump signed an executive order Wednesday that seeks to revive US shipbuilding and will dispatch Elon Musk’s efficiency squad to investigate how the US Navy fell so far behind in turning out vessels.】

item.title: 加拿大和墨西哥的关税未因特朗普的贸易转变而改变
item.description: 据一位白宫官员称，唐纳德-特朗普总统周三突然改变关税政策不会影响目前适用于加拿大和墨西哥产品的税率。【原文：President Donald Trump’s sudden change to tariff policy on Wednesday won’t affect the rates that currently apply Canadian and Mexican products, according to a White House official.】
